required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Qualitative Evaluation of Tear Fluid and Blood for Auto Antibodies Produced in Response to COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Qualitative Evaluation of Tear Fluid and Blood for IgM and IgG Produced in Response to SARS-CoV2, the Virus Responsible for COVID-19.

brief_summary.textblock: This study objective is to collect tear and blood samples from individuals with positive SARS-COV2 diagnosis and test those samples for the presence of various SARS-COV2 viral antigens and autoantibodies.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative assessment of IgM and/or IgG by indirect ELISA assay.
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, up to 8 months
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the presence or absence of IgM and/or IgG autoantibodies in response to SARS-CoV2 infection. In the case of presence, concentration may be determined as well.

arm_group.description: Tear Samples: Tear samples will be collected from 100 patients who have tested positive for the SARS-CoV2 virus. A total of 100 Blood samples will be drawn using standard phlebotomy techniques for venipuncture from patients who have tested positive for the SARS-CoV2 virus.
Control tear and serum samples will be selected from Namida Lab's own biorepository.

intervention.description: Through the data collected from this study we hope to support the development of an ELISA assay for the detection of IgM and IgG autoantibodies produced in response to the presence of SARS-CoV2

study_pop.textblock: Study participants will be recruited from hospital and health care settings testing and/or treating individuals for the presence of the SARS-CoV2 virus and resulting COVID-19 disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older Has been tested for SARS-CoV2 and awaiting results Sample collection for SARS-CoV2 testing Tested positive for SARS-CoV2 virus (confirmed by RT-PCR) prior to enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years of age Concurrent eye infection or trauma unrelated to presence of SARS-CoV2 virus. Advanced COVID-19 state what would preclude safe and feasible sample collection.

patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Supporting information can be obtained by making a request to the central study contact.
